e4: Changing to the new policy ensures transparent and unbiased financial reporting, aligning with ethical business practices and reducing the risk of legal issues. Although there is a risk of short-term investor misunderstanding, clear communication about the change can manage perceptions. Over time, transparency should enhance trust with investors, benefiting the company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring that all information presented is clear, unbiased, and truthful. It should consider the interests of all stakeholders, protect retail investors from potential disadvantages, and adhere to regulatory requirements. Timely and effective communication of any policy changes is crucial for maintaining trust and promoting fair market conditions.
e6: What steps will be taken to communicate the policy change to all investors to avoid misunderstanding? How will management monitor investor reactions and address any concerns post-implementation? Are there any measures planned to support retail investors who might be less informed about the change?
